medical_history.chief_complaint: Episodic hand and feet swellings and large oedematous plaques following manual tasks involving vibration.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began in 2019, starting 5 hours after exposure to vibration and lasting more than 24 hours. The intensity of symptoms increased with longer exposure, particularly after operating a surface drill rig for a full workday.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Asthma; diagnosed with Chronic Spontaneous Urticaria (CSU) in 2015.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is employed as a construction worker.
